question: [File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: result_state()] [State version consistency] Can result_state() return a LedgerState with a version that doesn't match the first_version + num_transactions in execution_output, causing version mismatches in downstream processing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Struct: PartialStateComputeResult] [Transaction status propagation] Are transaction statuses (success/failure) from execution_output properly propagated through state_checkpoint_output and ledger_update_output, or can status inconsistencies arise? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: set_state_checkpoint_output()] [Checkpoint hash validation] Does set_state_checkpoint_output() validate that the state_checkpoint_hashes in StateCheckpointOutput match the hashes computed from execution_output state changes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: ensure_state_checkpoint_output()] [State summary tampering] Can state_checkpoint_output contain a state_summary that doesn't match the actual state in result_state(), allowing attackers to commit to different state roots? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: ensure_result_state_summary()] [Chain of trust] Does the chain from execution_output → state_checkpoint_output → state_summary maintain cryptographic integrity, or can intermediate tampering occur? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: set_ledger_update_output()] [Transaction accumulator validation] Does set_ledger_update_output() validate that the transaction_accumulator in LedgerUpdateOutput correctly includes all transactions from execution_output? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: ensure_ledger_update_output()] [Transaction info consistency] Can the transaction_infos in ledger_update_output be inconsistent with the transactions in execution_output, causing transaction verification failures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: get_complete_result()] [Accumulator root binding] When creating StateComputeResult, is there validation that the ledger_update_output's accumulator root matches the cryptographic commitment in state_checkpoint_output? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Struct: PartialStateComputeResult] [Send/Sync safety] Is PartialStateComputeResult safely Send + Sync given the interior mutability of OnceCell, or can data races occur when shared across threads? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: set_state_checkpoint_output()] [Concurrent set attempts] If two threads simultaneously call set_state_checkpoint_output(), which panic occurs, and does the panic cleanup leave the OnceCell in a consistent state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: set_ledger_update_output()] [Concurrent set attempts] If two threads simultaneously call set_ledger_update_output(), which panic occurs, and does the panic cleanup leave the OnceCell in a consistent state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: get_complete_result()] [Race with setters] Can get_complete_result() be called concurrently with set_state_checkpoint_output() or set_ledger_update_output(), causing it to return Some() with incomplete data before the expect() check at line 100? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: new_empty()] [Empty block handling] Does new_empty() properly handle the case of empty blocks at epoch boundaries where reconfiguration occurs but no transactions execute? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: has_reconfiguration()] [Edge case: genesis block] Does has_reconfiguration() handle the genesis block correctly where next_epoch_state may be present for initialization without being a true reconfiguration? [File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: get_complete_result()] [None return handling] Are all callers of get_complete_result() prepared to handle the None case, or can Some() being expected but returning None cause downstream panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: new()] [Zero transaction block] Does new() correctly handle ExecutionOutput for blocks with zero committed transactions, or can this cause issues in subsequent pipeline stages? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: set_state_checkpoint_output()] [Idempotency violation] If execution is retried due to failures, can set_state_checkpoint_output() be called again with the same data, or will it panic preventing valid retry attempts? [File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: set_ledger_update_output()] [Idempotency violation] If ledger update is retried due to failures, can set_ledger_update_output() be called again with the same data, or will it panic preventing valid retry attempts? [File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Struct: PartialStateComputeResult] [Reuse after complete] Can a PartialStateComputeResult be reused after get_complete_result() returns Some(), or does reuse attempt to re-set OnceCell fields causing panics? (Medium)
